Use public transportation: While bicycles are not available, public transportation such as buses, trains, and subways can be used to travel around without a car.
Walk: Walking is a great alternative to driving a car. It's a healthy way to get around and can be done without any special equipment.
Use a scooter: Scooters are a fun and eco-friendly way to get around. They can be rented or purchased and are easy to maneuver in traffic.

Use a bike-sharing service: While bicycles may not be available, bike-sharing services are becoming increasingly popular in many cities. These services allow users to rent bicycles for short periods of time, making it a convenient way to get around.
Use a ride-sharing service: Ride-sharing services such as Uber and Lyft are great alternatives to driving a car. They allow users to quickly and easily get around without the hassle of owning a car.
